<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

### PR summary [5aa6d72106](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13768/commits/5aa6d72106b0396e4790fe51db2e08d96bea4510)

`+ map_comp`
`+ map_comp_apply`
`+ map_id`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>
@mkaratarakis when you've addressed a comment from a reviewer, you should get in the habit of clicking the "resolve conversation" button to remove clutter
maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.

Thanks! :tada:
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9531074782/job/26271635046)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9531074782/job/26271635194)

It's not hard to make `map` so arguably we don't need it, but the spelling is long and I'll be using it a lot in the automorphic forms work, so I think there's an argument for having it. 

I am not 100% sure that the simp linters will like the suggestion to change it to an `abbrev`.
Thanks! I suggested some simplifications.
Suggested a further simplification

It's not hard to make `map` so arguably we don't need it, but the spelling is long and I'll be using it a lot in the automorphic forms work, so I think there's an argument for having it. 

I am not 100% sure that the simp linters will like the suggestion to change it to an `abbrev`.

```suggestion
def map (n : ℕ) (f : R →+* S) : GL (Fin n) R →* GL (Fin n) S where
```
Does this not work with `(n : Type*) [Fintype n]` rather than `Fin n`?

```suggestion
variable {S T : Type*} [CommRing S] [CommRing T]
```
This allows `S` and `T` to live in different universes

```suggestion
        rw [← RingHom.map_mul, Units.val_inv g, RingHom.map_one _]
```
similarly below

```suggestion
    simp only [Units.inv_eq_val_inv, inv_one, coe_one, _root_.map_one,
      coe_toLinear]
    rfl
```
Similarly below

```suggestion
    map (g.comp f) = (map g).comp (map (n := n) f) :=
```

```suggestion
  map_one' := by aesop
  map_mul' _ _ := by aesop
```

```suggestion
      val_inv := by rw [← RingHom.map_mul, Units.val_inv, RingHom.map_one]
      inv_val := by rw [← RingHom.map_mul, Units.inv_val, RingHom.map_one]
```
You don't need (in this case) to give arguments to the lemmas in `rw`

Is it too long to fit on one line? Like this
```lean 
val_inv := by rw [← RingHom.map_mul, Units.val_inv, RingHom.map_one]
```

```suggestion
def map  (f : R →+* S) : GL n R →* GL n S :=
  Units.map <| (RingHom.mapMatrix f).toMonoidHom
```
Maybe it should be an `abbrev`

```suggestion
abbrev map  (f : R →+* S) : GL n R →* GL n S := Units.map <| (RingHom.mapMatrix f).toMonoidHom
```

```suggestion
    map (RingHom.id R) = MonoidHom.id (GL n R) :=
```

These last two proofs: why do you have one `rfl` on the same line and one on the next line? I don't know what the style guide says but I suspect it would like consistency :-) Maybe look up what the recommended style is?
I think that it should be a normal semireducible `def`, not an `abbrev`.

```suggestion
def map (f : R →+* S) : GL n R →* GL n S := Units.map <| (RingHom.mapMatrix f).toMonoidHom
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - A ring homomorphism ``f : R →+* S`` induces a homomorphism ``GLₙ(f) : GLₙ(R) →* GLₙ(S)``.
